body_html:
What are you doing once the machines start up in the cluster? Do they just need the TF library to be available, or are you building something from source?

If they just need TF to be available, you can switch from gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:devel to just gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow, which is a much smaller image (even beyond dropping the bazel cache).
body_text:
What are you doing once the machines start up in the cluster? Do they just need the TF library to be available, or are you building something from source?
If they just need TF to be available, you can switch from gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:devel to just gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow, which is a much smaller image (even beyond dropping the bazel cache).
body:
What are you doing once the machines start up in the cluster? Do they just need the TF library to be available, or are you building something from source?

If they just need TF to be available, you can switch from `gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:devel` to just `gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow`, which is a much smaller image (even beyond dropping the bazel cache).
